data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced an interim dividend in respect of the third quarter of 2012 of US$0.43 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share"), an increase of US$ 0.01 on the equivalent US dollar dividend for the same quarter last year.
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc third quarter 2012 interim dividend
data.maintext:
RDS provides eligible shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme ("the Programme"). For further details please see below.

Details relating to the third quarter 2012 interim dividend

It is expected that cash dividends on the B Shares will be paid via the Dividend Access Mechanism from UK-sourced income of the Shell Group.

Per ordinary shareQ3 2012
RDS A shares (US$)0.43
RDS B shares (US$)0.43

Cash dividends on A Shares will be paid, by default, in euro, although holders of A Shares will be able to elect to receive dividends in pounds sterling.

Cash dividends on B Shares will be paid, by default, in pounds sterling, although holders of B Shares will be able to elect to receive dividends in euro.

The pounds sterling & euro equivalent dividend payments will be announced on December 7, 2012.

Per ADSQ3 2012
RDS A ADSs (US$)0.86
RDS B ADSs (US$)0.86

Cash dividends on American Depository Shares ("ADSs") will be paid, by default, in US dollars.

ADS stands for an American Depositary Share. ADR stands for an American Depositary Receipt. An ADR is a certificate that evidences ADSs. ADSs are listed on the NYSE under the symbols RDS.A & RDS.B. Each ADS represents two ordinary shares, two A Shares in the case of RDS.A or two B Shares in the case of RDS.B. In many cases the terms ADR & ADS are used interchangeably.

Scrip Dividend Programme

RDS provides shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme.

Under the Programme shareholders can increase their shareholding in RDS by choosing to receive new shares instead of cash dividends, if approved by the Board. Only new A Shares will be issued under the Programme, including to shareholders who currently hold B Shares.

Joining the Programme may offer a tax advantage in some countries compared with receiving cash dividends. In particular, dividends paid out as shares will not be subject to Dutch dividend withholding tax (currently 15 per cent) & will not generally be taxed on receipt by a UK shareholder or a Dutch corporate shareholder.

Shareholders who elect to join the Programme will increase the number of shares held in RDS without having to buy existing shares in the market, thereby avoiding associated dealing costs.

Shareholders who do not join the Programme will continue to receive in cash any dividends approved by the Board.

Shareholders who held only B Shares & joined the Scrip Dividend Programme are reminded they will need to make a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of their new A Shares if they wish to join the Programme in respect of such new shares. However, this is only necessary if the shareholder has not previously made a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of any new A Shares issued.

For further information on the Programme, including how to join if you are eligible, please refer to the appropriate publication available on www.shell.com/scrip.

Dividend timetable for the third quarter 2012 interim dividend


3rd quarter 2012

Announcement dateNovember 1, 2012
Ex-dividend dateNovember 14, 2012
Record date November 16, 2012
Scrip reference share price announcement dateNovember 21, 2012
Closing of scrip election & currency election (*)November 30, 2012
Pounds sterling & euro equivalents announcement dateDecember 7, 2012
Payment dateDecember 20, 2012

* A different scrip election date may apply to registered & non registered ADS holders.
Registered ADS holders can contact The Bank of New York Mellon for the election deadline that applies. Non registered ADS holders can contact their broker, financial intermediary, bank or financial institution for the election deadline that applies.

Both a different scrip & currency election date may apply to shareholders holding shares in a securities account with a bank or financial institution ultimately holding through Euroclear Nederl&. Please contact your broker, financial intermediary, bank or financial institution where you hold your securities account for the election deadline that applies.

Taxation cash dividends

Cash dividends on A Shares will be subject to the deduction of Netherl&s dividend withholding tax at the rate of 15%, which may be reduced in certain circumstances. Provided certain conditions are met, shareholders in receipt of A Share cash dividends may also be entitled to a non-payable dividend tax credit in the United Kingdom.

Shareholders resident in the United Kingdom, receiving cash dividends on B Shares through the Dividend Access Mechanism, are entitled to a tax credit. This tax credit is not repayable. Non-residents may also be entitled to a tax credit, if double tax arrangements between the United Kingdom & their country of residence so provide, or if they are eligible for relief given to non-residents with certain special connections with the United Kingdom or to nationals of states in the European Economic Area.

The amount of tax credit is 10/90ths of the cash dividend, the tax credit referable to the third quarter 2012 interim dividend of US$0.43 is US$0.05 per ordinary share & the dividend & tax credit together amount to US$0.48. The pounds sterling & euro equivalents will be announced on December 7, 2012.

Royal Dutch Shell plc

The Hague, November 1, 2012

data.summary: Shell Petroleum Development Company of Nigeria Limited (SPDC), a subsidiary of Royal Dutch Shell plc (Shell), completed on August 31st 2012 the assignment of its 30% interest in Oil Mining Lease (OML) 40 in the Niger Delta to Elcrest Exploration & Production Nigeria Limited.  Total cash proceeds for SPDC amount to some US$102million.
data.title: SPDC completes sale of Nigerian oil mining lease
data.maintext:
p>This divestment is part of Shell's strategy of refocusing its onshore interests in Nigeria & in line with the Federal Government of Nigeria's aim of developing Nigerian companies in the country's upstream oil & gas business. Â Including this license, six onshore lease assignments have been completed by SPDC in Nigeria since 2010.

"These divestments mark another step in the strategy to re-focus the SPDC portfolio. SPDC is positioned well for investment & growth opportunities in all areas, including domestic gas, which will be delivered with the support of our government, partners & the people of Nigeria" said Mutiu Sunmonu, Country Chairman in Nigeria.

Shell has been in Nigeria for more than 50 years & remains committed to keeping a long-term presence there - both onshore & offshore. Â Through SPDC & its other Nigerian companies, it responsibly produces the oil & gas needed to fuel the economic & industrial growth that generates wealth for the nation & jobs for Nigerians.

Elcrest Exploration & Production Nigeria Limited is a majority Nigerian-owned consortium consisting of Starcrest Nigeria Energy Limited & El& Oil & Gas Limited. OML 40 covers an area of some 498 square kilometres & includes the Opuama, Abiala & Adagbassa Creek fields & related facilities. Operations had been shut down since 2006 because of militant activity.

Total E&P Nigeria Limited (10%) & Nigerian Agip Oil Company Limited (5%) have also assigned their interests in the lease, ultimately giving the buyers a 45% interest.

All approvals have been received from the relevant authorities of the Federal Government of Nigeria & the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation.

Notes to editors

SPDC is the operator of a joint venture between the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (55%), Shell (30%), Total E&P Nigeria Limited (10%) & Nigerian Agip Oil Company Limited (5%).

data.summary: Shell & Chevron agree strategic asset exchange
data.title: Shell increases browse equity stake
data.maintext:
Shell Development (Australia) Pty Ltd (Shell) & Chevron Australia Pty Ltd (Chevron) today announced that they have entered into a binding agreement for the exchange of Chevron's 16.7% interest in the East Browse titles(1) & Chevron's 20% interest in the West Browse titles(2) with Shell's 33.3% interest in the Clio-Acme titles(3). In addition to the assets exchanged, a further cash payment from Shell to Chevron of $450 million USD has been agreed.

Following completion of this transaction, Shell will hold a 35% interest in the West Browse titles & 25% interest in the East Browse titles.

The transaction is subject to governmental approval & regular processes for approval & registration of the dealings.

The transaction is consistent with Shell's growth strategy, securing material direct interests in major LNG supply projects.

&y Brown, Upstream International Director for Shell, said: "Shell is pleased to be growing its position in a major Australian gas resources & future Australian LNG supply project.

"This is a good deal, not only because it aligns with Shell's strategy of bigger direct stakes in key gas resources, but because it also helps to simplify the ownership of the Browse gas fields.

"The Browse gas fields are a key LNG development opportunity for Australia. We're committed to continue working with Woodside (as operator), the other JV participants & key stakeholders to secure the best possible development plan for this important resources."

This deal is the latest in a series of recent achievements for Shell's LNG business in the Asia Pacific region & further demonstrates Shell's long term commitment to the region.

Notes to editors

(1) East Browse titles include WA30R, WA31R, WA32R, WAR2 & TR5.

(2) West Browse titles include WA28R, WA29R & WA275P.

(3) Clio-Acme titles include WA42R & WA205P.

data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced the Reference Share Price in respect of the second quarter interim dividend of 2012, which was announced on July 26th, 2012 at $0.43 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share") & $0.86 per American Depository Share ("ADS").
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc second quarter 2012 scrip dividend programme reference share price
data.maintext:
Reference Share Price

The Reference Share price is used for calculating a Participating Shareholder's entitlement under the Scrip Dividend Programme, as defined below.

Q2 2012
Reference share price (US$)35.425

The Reference Share Price is the US dollar equivalent of the average of the closing price for the Company's A Shares listed on Euronext Amsterdam for the five dealing days commencing on (& including) the date on which the Shares are first quoted ex-dividend in respect of the relevant dividend.

The Reference Share Price is calculated by reference to the Euronext Amsterdam closing price in euro. The US dollar equivalent of the closing price on each of the dealing days referred to above is calculated using a market currency exchange rate prevailing at the time.

Reference ADS Price

ADS stands for "American Depositary Share". ADR stands for "American Depositary Receipt". An ADR is a certificate that evidences ADSs (though the terms ADR & ADS are often used interchangeably). ADSs are listed on the NYSE under the symbols RDS.A & RDS.B. Each ADS represents two ordinary shares, two ordinary A Shares in the case of RDS.A or two ordinary B Shares in the case of RDS.B.

Q2 2012
Reference ADS price (US$)70.850

The Reference ADS Price equals the Reference Share Price of the two A Shares underlying each new A ADS. A recent court ruling has established that Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (SDRT) is not due on the issue of shares to a US depositary. Therefore, the Reference ADS price no longer includes an adjustment for the deduction of SDRT (or the Dutch withholding tax associated with the payment of SDRT). Given these changes, there is no longer a need to have an Alternative Reference ADS Price. The Reference ADS Price will instead apply to all A ADSs & B ADSs.

Royal Dutch Shell plc is currently exploring together with the Depository how ADS holders might reclaim SDRT amounts deducted on previous issues under the Scrip Dividend Programme. Details will be made available as soon as possible on the dividend section of the Royal Dutch Shell plc website: www.shell.com/dividend.

Scrip dividend programme

RDS provides shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme.

Under the Programme shareholders can increase their shareholding in RDS by choosing to receive new shares instead of cash dividends if declared by RDS. Only new A Shares will be issued under the Programme, including to shareholders who currently hold B Shares.|

Joining the Programme may offer a tax advantage in some countries compared with receiving cash dividends. In particular, dividends paid out as shares will not be subject to Dutch dividend withholding tax (currently 15 per cent) & will not generally be taxed on receipt by a UK shareholder or a Dutch corporate shareholder.

Shareholders who elect to join the Programme will increase the number of shares held in RDS without having to buy existing shares in the market, thereby avoiding associated dealing costs.

Shareholders who do not join the Programme will continue to receive in cash any dividends declared by RDS.

Shareholders who held only B shares & joined the Scrip Dividend Programme are reminded they will need to make a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of their new A shares if they wish to join the Programme in respect of such new shares. However, this is only necessary if the shareholder has not previously made a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of any new A shares issued.

For further information on the Programme, including how to join if you are eligible, please refer to the appropriate publication available on www.shell.com/scrip.

data.summary: Shell announced today the signing of an agreement with Hess Corporation to acquire its interests in the Beryl area fields & the Scottish Area Gas Evacuation System ("SAGE"), for US$ 525 million.
data.title: Shell to increase participation in the Beryl area fields in the North Sea
data.maintext:
The Beryl Area includes 12 fields located on the UK Continental Shelf. The fields are operated by Apache & with the acquisition Shell’s interest in the different fields will increase by a range of between 9-65% depending on the field.

The Beryl cluster has a far longer anticipated lifetime than originally thought & may produce for a further two decades. The acquisition should help to enhance the performance & economic potential from key Shell North Sea operated & non-operated assets, lifting Shell’s production in the Beryl area fields from currently 9 thousand boe/d to 24 thousand boe/d. Shell intends to invest in these assets to substantially extend the production life, for potentially a further 20 years.

Notes to editors

1. Shell is a leading operator in the UK sector of the North Sea & intends to maintain this position. Offshore, Shell has interests in more than 50 fields, operates more than 30 platform installations, 30 subsea installations & one production (FPSO) vessel. Onshore, we operate three gas plants; the St. Fergus Gas Terminal & Fife NGL Plant (with Braefoot Bay marine terminal) in Scotl&, & Bacton in the east of England. Shell operates a significant number of its interests in the UK Continental Shelf (UKCS) on behalf of a 50:50 joint venture with ExxonMobil. The Shell share of UK oil & gas production is about 8% (140 kboe/d in 2011). Almost half of this is gas. This is almost 4% of total Shell Group production.

2. Shell & Hess Corporation signed an agreement on May 29, 2012 to acquire Hess’s 15.67% interest in the BP operated Schiehallion field. The sale which completed on 28 September 2012 brings Shell’s equity in Schiehallion to 49%.

3. In 2010 we increased our interest in the Clair field from 18% to 28%. Clair lies west of Shetl& & is operated by BP.

4. The increase in Shell share of fields is as follows: Beryl, Nevis Central, Nevis North, Nevis Far North, Nevis South Cormorant, Loirston, Ness & Ness South from 23% to 45%. Nevis South from 14.8% to 52.2%. On Nevis West Beryl from 0% to 65.5%. On Buckl& from 14.4% to 28.5%, & from 15.9% to 25% on Skene.

data.summary: Today Shell celebrated the cutting of first steel for the game-changing Prelude floating liquefied natural gas (FLNG) facility’s substructure with joint venture participants, Inpex & KOGAS, & lead contractor, the Technip Samsung Consortium, at Samsung Heavy Industries’ Geoje shipyard in South Korea.
data.title: Major construction begins on the Prelude FLNG project - the world's biggest offshore floating facility
data.maintext:
Shell’s Projects & Technology Director Matthias Bichsel commented: "We are cutting 7.6 tonnes of steel for the Prelude floating liquefied natural gas facility today, but in total, more than 260,000 tonnes of steel will be fabricated & assembled for the facility. That’s around five times the amount of steel used to build the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Today’s ceremony marks a major milestone in this project, when the innovative thinking & new technology & engineering solutions which will make FLNG possible begin to be realised."

When completed, the Prelude FLNG facility will be 488 metres long & 74 metres wide, making it the largest offshore floating facility ever built. When fully equipped & with its cargo tanks full, it will weigh more than 600,000 tonnes. There will be over 3,000 kilometres of electrical & instrumentation cables on the FLNG facility, the distance from Barcelona to Moscow.

"Making FLNG a reality is no simple feat," Matthias continued. "Shell is uniquely positioned to make it a success given our commercial capability; our LNG, offshore, deepwater & marine technology; & our proven ability to successfully deliver megaprojects."

In order to meet the world’s growing energy demand, bringing new supplies to market is critical. The Prelude FLNG facility will be deployed in Australian waters over 200 kilometres from the nearest point on the coast. It will produce gas at sea, turn it into liquefied natural gas & then transfer it directly to the ships that will transport it to customers.

An expert team from Shell will manage the multi-year construction of the FLNG facility to ensure the Prelude project’s critical dimensions of safety, quality, cost & schedule are delivered. Strategic partners Technip & Samsung Heavy Industries (the Technip Samsung Consortium) along with SBM & hundreds of suppliers & contractors around the world are all contributing valuable knowledge, skills & equipment to help make the project a success. At peak levels, around 5,000 people will be working on the construction of the FLNG facility in South Korea; & another 1,000 will build the turret mooring system, subsea & wells equipment in other locations across the globe.

In the lead up to the facility being ready to start production, a number of actions will take place, such as drilling the production wells, installation of subsea flowlines & risers & mooring chains to prepare for the arrival of the FLNG facility.

Prelude FLNG is the latest in a line of Shell achievements in developing new technologies for the oil & gas industry, reinforcing its leadership in technology & innovation. This is the first of what Shell expects to be multiple Shell FLNG projects.

Notes to editors

In 2012, Australian subsidiaries of INPEX Corporation (17.5%) & Korea Gas Corporation (10%) joined the Prelude FLNG project. An Australian subsidiary of CPC Corporation (5%) has also signed an agreement to do so. Completion of this transaction remains subject to conditions including Taiwanese government approval. By taking a stake in the project, INPEX, KOGAS & CPC show the confidence they place in Shell’s FLNG technology.

FLNG will enable the development of gas resources ranging from clusters of smaller more remote fields to potentially larger fields via multiple facilities where, for a range of reasons, an onshore development is not viable. This can mean faster, cheaper, more flexible development & deployment strategies for resources that were previously uneconomic, or constrained by technical or other risks.

Many of the technologies used on the FLNG facility are ones that Shell has used successfully onshore, but some have been extended or modified for offshore. The new technologies that Shell developed for FLNG include: managing sloshing in LNG tanks; systems for managing the close coupling between the producing wells & the LNG processing facility; LNG offloading arms; water intake risers; mooring systems; & the marinisation of processing equipment such as absorption columns & the main cryogenic heat exchangers. All of these technologies have been extensively modelled & tested to ensure they can operate safely & efficiently under marine conditions.

Shell’s innovation in FLNG has been recognised by the industry including:

  • Lloyd’s List award for Technological Innovation 2012
  • CWC / WGI LNG Award for Outstanding Contribution to the Industry 2011

data.maintext:

data.summary: Royal Dutch Shell ("Shell") is engaged in a multi-year drilling programme to explore for new oil & gas resources in high-potential blocks in offshore Alaska. Important progress has been made with this programme, with two drill ships, more than twenty support vessels, an approved capping stack, & other redundant oil spill response equipment already in position. Shell continues to demonstrate the strength & extent of its Arctic preparations.
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell Alaska drilling update
data.maintext:
Over the last several days, Shell has successfully completed a series of tests of the first-ever Arctic Containment System. However, during a final test, the containment dome aboard the Arctic Challenger barge was damaged. It is clear that some days will be required to repair & fully assess dome readiness. We are disappointed that the dome has not yet met our stringent acceptance standards; but, as we have said all along, we will not conduct any operation until we are satisfied that we are fully prepared to do it safely.

The time required to repair the dome, along with steps we have taken to protect local whaling operations & to ensure the safety of operations from ice floe movement, have led us to revise our plans for the 2012-2013 exploration program. In order to lay a strong foundation for operations in 2013, we will forgo drilling into hydrocarbon zones this year. Instead, we will begin as many wells, known as â€˜top holes,’ as time remaining in this season allows. The top portion of the wells drilled in the days & weeks ahead will be safely capped & temporarily ab&oned this year, in accordance with regulatory requirements. We look forward to the final receipt of our drilling permits for the multi-year exploration program upon the successful testing & deployment of the Arctic Containment System.

These capabilities have, most recently, been evident in Shell’s ice management operations as it successfully moved one of its drill ships & support vessels safely out of the path of approaching sea ice. That drill ship, the Noble Discoverer, is expected to resume its position & drilling operations over the â€˜Burger A’ prospect in the days ahead.

Also, in the coming days, Shell is expected to begin exploratory drilling in the Beaufort Sea. These operations will follow the conclusion of the fall whale hunt & the anticipated receipt of a top hole drilling permit.

We have tested & assembled drill ships & support vessels, trained personnel, & acquired numerous final approved plans & permits. This exploration program remains critically important to America’s energy needs, to the economy & jobs in Alaska, & to Shell.

data.summary: Royal Dutch Shell plc ("Shell") today said it acquired acreage in Texas from Chesapeake Energy in a further step to build a leading portfolio of shale assets rich in oil & natural gas liquids.  The $1.935 billion transaction is expected to close within 30 days.
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell acquires liquids-rich shale acreage in Texas
data.maintext:
This announcement supports Shell’s strategy of further building an industry-leading liquids-rich shale resources. The acquisition provides both existing production & near-term growth potential from a proven resources, as well as promising opportunities for expansion.

The acquisition covers 618,000 net acres in the Permian Basin in West Texas that currently produces some 26,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day & has significant growth potential.

data.summary: Royal Dutch Shell plc announced today it has agreed to sell its 50% working interest in the Holstein Field, comprised of Green Canyon Blocks 644, 645 & 688 in the Gulf of Mexico, to Plains Exploration & Production (PXP) for approximately $560 million, subject to closing.
data.title: Shell accepts offer for working interest in Gulf of Mexico Holstein asset
data.maintext:
Shell received an unsolicited offer from PXP for Shell’s working interest. The transaction is effective October 1, 2012 & is expected to close by year-end 2012.

Holstein is a mature deepwater asset & the sale is consistent with Shell’s continuing practice of reviewing our existing portfolio & evaluating new opportunities.

The Holstein Unit is centered on a spar platform anchored in 1350 meters (4400 feet) water depth & first produced in December 2004. Shell’s 50% interest represents about two percent of the company’s overall Gulf of Mexico net production & had a 30-day net average production of 7.4 kboe/d prior to Hurricane Isaac.

Shell retains a major Gulf of Mexico presence & is a leading deepwater producer. The company recently noted three successful appraisal wells at the Appomattox & Vito fields, which are expected to begin producing in the second half of the decade.

Notes to editors

Shell holds 50% interest in Holstein. BP (operator) holds the remaining 50%.

data.summary: The Shell Petroleum Development Company of Nigeria Limited (SPDC), a subsidiary of Royal Dutch Shell plc (Shell), has completed the assignment of its 30% interest in Oil Mining Lease 34 (OML-34) in the Niger Delta to ND Western Limited. Total cash proceeds for Shell amount to some US$400 million.
data.title: SPDC completes sale of the seventh Nigerian oil mining lease
data.maintext:
This divestment is part of Shell’s strategy of refocusing its onshore interests in Nigeria & is in line with the Federal Government of Nigeria’s aim of developing Nigerian companies in the country’s upstream oil & gas business. This is the seventh onshore lease assignment that SPDC has completed in Nigeria since 2010.

Shell has been in Nigeria for more than 50 years & remains committed to keeping a long-term presence there – both onshore & offshore. Through SPDC & its other Nigerian companies, Shell responsibly produces the oil & gas needed to fuel the economic & industrial growth that generates wealth for the nation & jobs for Nigerians.

OML 34 covers an area of some 950 square kilometres & includes the Utorogu, Ughelli & Warri River fields & related facilities. The combined fields currently produce just under 300 million standard cubic feet per day of gas & 15,000 barrels per day of oil & condensate (100%).

Total E&P Nigeria Limited (10%) & Nigerian Agip Oil Company Limited (5%) have also assigned their interests in the lease, ultimately giving ND Western Limited a 45% interest.

All approvals have been received from the relevant authorities of the Federal Government of Nigeria.

Notes for editors

SPDC is the operator of a joint venture between the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (55%), Shell (30%), Total E&P Nigeria Limited (10%) & Nigerian Agip Oil Company Limited (5%).

data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced the pounds sterling & euro equivalent dividend payments in respect of the second quarter 2012 interim dividend, which was announced on July 26, 2012 at US$0.43 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share").
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc second quarter 2012 Euro & GBP equivalent dividend payments
data.maintext:
Dividends on A Shares will be paid, by default, in euro at the rate of €0.3421 per A Share. Holders of A Shares who have validly submitted pounds sterling currency elections by August 24, 2012 will be entitled to a dividend of 27.08p per A Share.

Dividends on B Shares will be paid, by default, in pounds sterling at the rate of 27.08p per B Share. Holders of B Shares who have validly submitted euro currency elections by August 24, 2012 will be entitled to a dividend of €0.3421 per B Share.

This dividend will be payable on September 20, 2012 to those members whose names were on the Register of Members on August 10, 2012.

Taxation cash dividends

Dividends on A Shares will be subject to the deduction of Netherl&s dividend withholding tax at the rate of 15%, which may be reduced in certain circumstances. Provided certain conditions are met, shareholders in receipt of A Share dividends may also be entitled to a non-payable dividend tax credit in the United Kingdom.

Shareholders resident in the United Kingdom, receiving dividends on B Shares through the Dividend Access Mechanism, are entitled to a tax credit. This tax credit is not repayable. Non-residents may also be entitled to a tax credit, if double tax arrangements between the United Kingdom & their country of residence so provide, or if they are eligible for relief given to non-residents with certain special connections with the United Kingdom or to nationals of states in the European Economic Area.

The amount of tax credit is 10/90ths of the cash dividend, the tax credit referable to the second quarter 2012 interim dividend of US$0.43 (27.08p or €0.3421) is US$0.05 (3.01p or €0.0380) per ordinary share & the dividend & tax credit together amount to US$0.48 (30.09p or €0.3801).

data.summary: At 07.00 BST (08.00 CEST & 02.00 EDT) on Thursday 26 July, 2012 Royal Dutch Shell plc released its second quarter results & second quarter interim dividend announcement for 2012.
data.title: Second quarter 2012 results & interim dividend announcement
data.maintext:
Royal Dutch Shell Chief Executive Officer Peter Voser commented:

"We are moving forward in volatile times. Our profits have fallen with energy prices, but our growth strategy is delivering to the bottom line.

Shell's second quarter 2012 earnings declined from year-ago levels, with weaker oil & North American gas prices offsetting the benefit of increased upstream volumes & improved refining margins. Our profits pay for Shell's dividends & substantial investments in new projects, to ensure affordable & reliable energy supplies for our customers, adding value for our shareholders."

Voser continued: "Our industry continues to see significant energy price volatility as a result of economic & political developments. Shell is implementing a long-term, consistent strategy against this volatile backdrop. Our plans for organic capital investment of around $32 billion in 2012 & medium-term financial & production growth are on track...."; [read the full comment in the Quarterly Results Announcement]

data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced an interim dividend in respect of the second quarter of 2012 of US$0.43 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share"), an increase of US$ 0.01 on the equivalent US dollar dividend for the same quarter last year.
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc second quarter 2012 interim dividend
data.maintext:
RDS provides eligible shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme ("the Programme"). For further details please see below.

Details relating to the second quarter 2012 interim dividend

It is expected that cash dividends on the B Shares will be paid via the Dividend Access Mechanism from UK-sourced income of the Shell Group.

Per ordinary shareQ2 2012
RDS A shares (US$)0.43
RDS B shares (US$)0.43

Dividends declared on A Shares will be paid, by default, in euro, although holders of A Shares will be able to elect to receive dividends in pounds sterling.

Dividends declared on B Shares will be paid, by default, in pounds sterling, although holders of B Shares will be able to elect to receive dividends in euro.

The pounds sterling & euro equivalent dividend payments will be announced on September 3, 2012.

Per ADSQ2 2012
RDS A ADSs (US$)0.86
RDS B ADSs (US$)0.86

Dividends declared on American Depository Shares ("ADSs") will be paid, by default, in US dollars.

ADS stands for an American Depositary Share. ADR stands for an American Depositary Receipt. An ADR is a certificate that evidences ADSs. ADSs are listed on the NYSE under the symbols RDS.A & RDS.B. Each ADS represents two ordinary shares, two A Shares in the case of RDS.A or two B Shares in the case of RDS.B. In many cases the terms ADR & ADS are used interchangeably.

Scrip Dividend Programme

RDS provides shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme.

Under the Programme shareholders can increase their shareholding in RDS by choosing to receive new shares instead of cash dividends if declared by RDS. Only new A Shares will be issued under the Programme, including to shareholders who currently hold B Shares.

Joining the Programme may offer a tax advantage in some countries compared with receiving cash dividends. In particular, dividends paid out as shares will not be subject to Dutch dividend withholding tax (currently 15 per cent) & will not generally be taxed on receipt by a UK shareholder or a Dutch corporate shareholder.

Shareholders who elect to join the Programme will increase the number of shares held in RDS without having to buy existing shares in the market, thereby avoiding associated dealing costs.

Shareholders who do not join the Programme will continue to receive in cash any dividends declared by RDS.

Shareholders who held only B Shares & joined the Scrip Dividend Programme are reminded they will need to make a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of their new A Shares if they wish to join the Programme in respect of such new shares. However, this is only necessary if the shareholder has not previously made a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of any new A Shares issued.

For further information on the Programme, including how to join if you are eligible, please refer to the appropriate publication available on www.shell.com/scrip.

Dividend timetable for the second quarter 2012 interim dividend


2nd quarter 2012

Announcement dateJuly 26, 2012
Ex-dividend dateAugust 8, 2012
Record date August 10, 2012
Scrip reference share price announcement dateAugust 15, 2012
Closing of scrip election & currency election (*)August 24, 2012
Pounds sterling & euro equivalents announcement dateSeptember 3, 2012
Payment dateSeptember 20, 2012

* A different scrip election date may apply to registered & non registered ADS holders.
Registered ADS holders can contact The Bank of New York Mellon for the election deadline that applies. Non registered ADS holders can contact their broker, financial intermediary, bank or financial institution for the election deadline that applies.
Both a different scrip & currency election date may apply to shareholders holding shares in a securities account with a bank or financial institution ultimately holding through Euroclear Nederl&. Please contact your broker, financial intermediary, bank or financial institution where you hold your securities account for the election deadline that applies.

Taxation cash dividends

Cash dividends on A Shares will be subject to the deduction of Netherl&s dividend withholding tax at the rate of 15%, which may be reduced in certain circumstances. Provided certain conditions are met, shareholders in receipt of A Share cash dividends may also be entitled to a non-payable dividend tax credit in the United Kingdom.

Shareholders resident in the United Kingdom, receiving cash dividends on B Shares through the Dividend Access Mechanism, are entitled to a tax credit. This tax credit is not repayable. Non-residents may also be entitled to a tax credit, if double tax arrangements between the United Kingdom & their country of residence so provide, or if they are eligible for relief given to non-residents with certain special connections with the United Kingdom or to nationals of states in the European Economic Area.

The amount of tax credit is 10/90ths of the cash dividend, the tax credit referable to the second quarter 2012 interim dividend of US$0.43 is US$0.05 per ordinary share & the dividend & tax credit together amount to US$0.48. The pounds sterling & euro equivalents will be announced on September 3, 2012.

Royal Dutch Shell plc

data.summary: Shell announces today that it has signed two offshore oil & gas Production Sharing Contracts (PSCs) with CNOOC, & a PSC amendment with CNPC for a new development phase for the Changbei gas field in China. Shell has also entered an agreement with CNOOC for its participation in two Shell exploration blocks offshore Gabon, West Africa.
data.title: Shell signs new Upstream deals with CNOOC & CNPC
data.maintext:
p>The two offshore oil & gas PSCs with CNOOC are for blocks 62/02 & 62/17 in the Yinggehai Basin. Shell, as operator, will apply advanced seismic acquisition & processing technologies to conduct 3D seismic data surveys in the Yinggehai blocks. Shell will cover the costs for the acquisition of seismic data & will use advanced drilling technologies to drill exploration wells during the exploration phase. Shell will hold a 100% working interest during the exploration phase, that will be reduced to 49% in any eventual development phase, with CNOOC as majority partner.

The onshore tight gas PSC amendment with CNPC represents a new phase for the development of the existing Changbei block with 1,692.5 square kilometers in the Ordos Basin, & adds scope to develop additional tight gas sands & further develop the already producing main reservoir. Subject to government approval & pending the outcome of the appraisal campaign, this additional development project could increase the current production plateau of 320mmscf/d. Shell will continue to be the operator at Changbei.

In Gabon, CNOOC will acquire a 25% participating interest in offshore exploration blocks BC9 & BCD10. CNOOC will reimburse Shell for 25% of certain past exploration costs & carry part of the future exploration costs. Shell will remain operator with 75% interest. The agreement is subject to government approval. Lim Haw-Kuang, Executive Chairman of Shell Companies in China, said: "We are delighted about the return to offshore exploration in China & the opportunity to work with CNOOC again on a major project in the country. We are equally delighted to continue & expand the Changbei success story in partnership with CNPC. Moreover, we are very pleased to have entered the farm-out agreement with CNOOC in Gabon. These new projects in partnership with Chinese companies are the latest showcase of our China strategy to work with our Chinese counterparts both in China & globally to help meet the country's energy needs to fuel its fast growing economy."

Notes to editors

Royal Dutch Shell plc is incorporated in England & Wales, has its headquarters in The Hague & is listed on the London, Amsterdam, & New York stock exchanges. Shell companies have operations in more than 90 countries & territories with businesses including oil & gas exploration & production; production & marketing of liquefied natural gas & gas to liquids; manufacturing, marketing & shipping of oil products & chemicals & renewable energy projects. For further information, visit www.shell.com.

In China, Shell operates the onshore Changbei tight-gas field under a PSC with PetroChina. The two parties have also agreed to appraise, develop & produce tight gas in the Jinqiu block in the central Sichuan province under a 30-year PSC (Shell interest 49%), which expires in 2040. The Jinqiu project achieved first gas production in September 2011. Also in Sichuan, Shell & PetroChina are assessing shale gas opportunities in the Fushun-Yongchuan block. The two parties are also assessing opportunities in coalbed methane in the Ordos Basin, where Shell has an agreement to evaluate resources in North Shilou. Shell is also a partner in the Hangzhou city ring joint venture that develops, operates & manages a high-pressure natural gas pipeline system.

Our Downstream business in China has 15 joint ventures & 9 wholly-owned companies. The various Shell ventures cover about 700 Retail fuel stations, 7 Lubricant blending plants, 10 Bitumen plants, & the Nanhai Petrochemicals complex.

data.summary: Shell, the current owner of 4.1% of the shares in Gasnor AS, has signed a Share Purchase Agreement for the acquisition of the remaining outstanding shares in the company for USD 74 million (NOK 455.5 million). Subject to Norwegian regulatory approvals, the transaction is expected to be closed in the 3rd quarter of 2012.
data.title: Shell signs share purchase agreement to acquire Gasnor
data.maintext:
Gasnor is a market leader in Norway in small scale LNG (Liquefied Natural Gas), supplying LNG as a fuel to industrial & marine customers & operating an end to end supply chain, with three small scale production plants & distribution assets including two tanker ships, a fleet of trucks & a network of terminals. The acquisition of Gasnor is an important step for Shell towards creating an LNG sales business. LNG will be a reliable new addition to Shell's commercial customers' fuel mix.

Colin Abraham, Shell's Vice President for Downstream LNG, said: "The benefits of natural gas in meeting our future energy needs are well-documented. Shell believes the Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) in transport sector will develop into a sizeable market & given its industry leading expertise across the LNG value chain, the extension into this market is a good fit for Shell. The Gasnor acquisition provides Shell with invaluable customer & market insight built up over a number of years. This will help us to quickly develop & meet customer requirements for LNG as a transport fuel."

Through this acquisition, Shell will capitalise on Gasnor's experience in LNG sales & marketing, combining it with its own customer reach to target European marine customers ahead of new environmental regulations that will come into force from 2015. These regulations will apply across the Baltic Sea, English Channel & North Sea & will require lower levels of Ã¢€Ëœair-quality emissions' such as sulphur oxides (SOx) & nitrogen oxides (NOx). Switching to LNG can help to reduce these emissions. Shell expects European marine LNG to be a key growth sector as customers look for cleaner, cost competitive fuel alternatives as part of their fuel supply mix.

Eilef Stange, Gasnor's Chief Executive Officer, said: "Shell's customer reach & Gasnor's LNG sales & marketing experience is a winning combination. There is real growth potential for small scale LNG in Europe, particularly in the marine sector, & Gasnor with Shell is well placed to capitalise on this."

LNG as a marine fuel is not new. LNG has been used to power gas engines in LNG carriers for many years. Shell has been a pioneer in this area, & has an excellent track record in terms of the safe storage, h&ling & movement of LNG.

In September 2011 Shell took its first final investment decision on a LNG for transport project in Canada to supply LNG to Shell Flying J truck stops for use by heavy truck fleets. In June 2012, Shell signed a memor&um of understanding with TravelCenters of America LLC (TA) to sell LNG to heavy-duty road transport customers in the US through TA's existing nationwide network of full-service fueling centers.

Note to editors

  • Shell is a global leader in upstream LNG & helped pioneer the liquefied natural gas (LNG) sector, providing the technology for the world's first commercial liquefaction plant in 1964. Shell is a participant in nine operating LNG projects with some 21.5 million tonnes per annum operational LNG capacity, in seven countries. It has three new projects under construction with 15 mtpa of LNG options. Shell was a partner in the first-ever purpose built LNG carrier & has been delivering LNG safely for nearly half a century. Today Shell is the world's largest LNG shipping operator, with interests in around a quarter of the LNG vessels in operation.
  • Norway was one of the first European countries to focus on LNG as a fuel & this forward thinking helped foster Gasnor's pioneering approach. Shell already has an upstream & downstream presence in Norway & this LNG acquisition is part of Norske Shell's growth ambitions.

data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc first quarter 2012 euro & GBP equivalent dividend payments
data.maintext:
p>Dividends on A Shares will be paid, by default, in euro at the rate of Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3468 per A Share. Holders of A Shares who have validly submitted pounds sterling currency elections by May 25, 2012 will be entitled to a dividend of 27.92p per A Share.

Dividends on B Shares will be paid, by default, in pounds sterling at the rate of 27.92p per B Share. Holders of B Shares who have validly submitted euro currency elections by May 25, 2012 will be entitled to a dividend of Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3468 per B Share.

This dividend will be payable on June 21, 2012 to those members whose names were on the Register of Members on May 11, 2012.

Taxation cash dividends

Dividends on A Shares will be subject to the deduction of Netherl&s dividend withholding tax at the rate of 15%, which may be reduced in certain circumstances. Provided certain conditions are met, shareholders in receipt of A Share dividends may also be entitled to a non-payable dividend tax credit in the United Kingdom.

Shareholders resident in the United Kingdom, receiving dividends on B Shares through the Dividend Access Mechanism, are entitled to a tax credit. This tax credit is not repayable. Non-residents may also be entitled to a tax credit, if double tax arrangements between the United Kingdom & their country of residence so provide, or if they are eligible for relief given to non-residents with certain special connections with the United Kingdom or to nationals of states in the European Economic Area.

The amount of tax credit is 10/90ths of the cash dividend, the tax credit referable to the first quarter 2012 interim dividend of US$0.43 (27.92p or Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3468) is US$0.05 (3.10p or Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.0385) per ordinary share & the dividend & tax credit together amount to US$0.48 (31.02p or Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3853).

data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced the Reference Share Price in respect of the first quarter interim dividend of 2012, which was announced on April 26th, 2012 at $0.43 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share") & $0.86 per American Depository Share ("ADS").
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc first quarter 2012 scrip dividend programme reference share price
data.maintext:
Reference Share Price

The Reference Share price is used for calculating a Participating Shareholder's entitlement under the Scrip Dividend Programme, as defined below.

Q1 2012
Reference share price (US$)32.785

The Reference Share Price is the US dollar equivalent of the average of the closing price for the Company's A Shares listed on Euronext Amsterdam for the five dealing days commencing on (& including) the date on which the Shares are first quoted ex-dividend in respect of the relevant dividend.

The Reference Share Price is calculated by reference to the Euronext Amsterdam closing price in euro. The US dollar equivalent of the closing price on each of the dealing days referred to above is calculated using a market currency exchange rate prevailing at the time.

Reference ADS Price

ADS stands for "American Depositary Share". ADR stands for "American Depositary Receipt". An ADR is a certificate that evidences ADSs (though the terms ADR & ADS are often used interchangeably). ADSs are listed on the NYSE under the symbols RDS.A & RDS.B. Each ADS represents two ordinary shares, two ordinary A Shares in the case of RDS.A or two ordinary B Shares in the case of RDS.B.

Q1 2012
Reference ADS price (US$)65.570

The Reference ADS Price equals the Reference Share Price of the two A Shares underlying each new A ADS. A recent court ruling has established that Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (SDRT) is not due on the issue of shares to a US depositary. Therefore, the Reference ADS price no longer includes an adjustment for the deduction of SDRT (or the Dutch withholding tax associated with the payment of SDRT). Given these changes, there is no longer a need to have an Alternative Reference ADS Price. The Reference ADS Price will instead apply to all A ADSs & B ADSs.

Royal Dutch Shell plc is currently exploring together with the Depository how ADS holders might reclaim SDRT amounts deducted on previous issues under the Scrip Dividend Programme. Details will be made available as soon as possible on the dividend section of the Royal Dutch Shell plc website: www.shell.com/dividend.

Scrip dividend programme

RDS provides shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme.

Under the Programme shareholders can increase their shareholding in RDS by choosing to receive new shares instead of cash dividends if declared by RDS. Only new A Shares will be issued under the Programme, including to shareholders who currently hold B Shares.

Joining the Programme may offer a tax advantage in some countries compared with receiving cash dividends. In particular, dividends paid out as shares will not be subject to Dutch dividend withholding tax (currently 15 per cent) & will not generally be taxed on receipt by a UK shareholder or a Dutch corporate shareholder.

Shareholders who elect to join the Programme will increase the number of shares held in RDS without having to buy existing shares in the market, thereby avoiding associated dealing costs.

Shareholders who do not join the Programme will continue to receive in cash any dividends declared by RDS.

Shareholders who held only B shares & joined the Scrip Dividend Programme are reminded they will need to make a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of their new A shares if they wish to join the Programme in respect of such new shares. However, this is only necessary if the shareholder has not previously made a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of any new A shares issued.

For further information on the Programme, including how to join if you are eligible, please refer to the appropriate publication available on www.shell.com/scrip.

Royal Dutch Shell plc
The Hague, May 16,2012

data.summary: Shell, Korea Gas Corporation (KOGAS), Mitsubishi Corporation, & PetroChina Company Limited today announced they are developing a proposed liquefied natural gas (LNG) export facility in Western Canada, near Kitimat, British Columbia.
data.title: Shell & partners announce LNG project in Canada
data.maintext:
This project will help make Canada's abundant supplies of cleaner-burning natural gas available to global markets including Asia's dynamic & fast-growing economies. It brings together partners with a unique combination of strengths: innovation, financial muscle, development expertise & access to important markets.

Shell holds a 40% interest in the LNG Canada project (www.LNGCanada.ca), with KOGAS, Mitsubishi & PetroChina each holding a 20% interest. The proposed project includes the design, construction & operation of a gas liquefaction plant & facilities for the storage & export of LNG, including marine off-loading facilities & shipping.

LNG Canada will initially have two LNG processing units, or "trains," each with the capacity to produce six million tonnes of LNG annually, with an option to expand the project in the future.

The partners will decide whether to move ahead with the project's development after conducting engineering work & environmental assessments, as well as consultations with local communities & other stakeholders. Start-up could come around the end of the decade, assuming all necessary regulatory approvals & investment decisions.

The project announcement comes in the context of growing demand for natural gas in Asia & elsewhere, as countries look to support economic development with cleaner forms of energy.

data.summary: At 07.00 BST (08.00 CEST & 02.00 EDT) on Thursday 26 April, 2012 Royal Dutch Shell plc released its first quarter results & first quarter interim dividend announcement for 2012.
data.title: First quarter 2012 results & interim dividend announcement
data.maintext:
Royal Dutch Shell Chief Executive Officer Peter Voser commented:

"We are making good progress against our targets to deliver a more competitive performance. Our profits pay for Shell's dividends & substantial investments in new energy projects, to ensure affordable, reliable energy supplies for our customers, which create value for our shareholders.

Shell's first quarter 2012 earnings increased from year-ago levels, through a combination of improved operating performance, increased upstream volumes & strong oil prices. Energy demand fundamentals are robust, but with near-term volatility in energy prices as a result of economic & political events. In downstream & North American natural gas we see continued challenges for our industry."

"We are implementing our strategy by improving near-term performance, delivering a new wave of production growth & maturing the next generation of growth options for shareholders ..."; [read the full comment in the Quarterly Results Announcement]

data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced an interim dividend in respect of the first quarter of 2012 of US$0.43 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share"), an increase of US$ 0.01 on the equivalent US dollar dividend for the same quarter last year.
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc first quarter 2012 interim dividend
data.maintext:
RDS provides eligible shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme ("the Programme"). For further details please see below.

Details relating to the first quarter 2012 interim dividend

It is expected that cash dividends on the B Shares will be paid via the Dividend Access Mechanism from UK-sourced income of the Shell Group.

Per ordinary shareQ1 2012
RDS A shares (US$)0.43
RDS B shares (US$)0.43

Dividends declared on A Shares will be paid, by default, in euro, although holders of A Shares will be able to elect to receive dividends in pounds sterling.

Dividends declared on B Shares will be paid, by default, in pounds sterling, although holders of B Shares will be able to elect to receive dividends in euro.

The pounds sterling & euro equivalent dividend payments will be announced on June 1, 2012.

Per ADSQ1 2012
RDS A ADSs (US$)0.86
RDS B ADSs (US$)0.86

Dividends declared on American Depository Shares ("ADSs") will be paid, by default, in US dollars.

ADS stands for an American Depositary Share. ADR stands for an American Depositary Receipt. An Â ADR is a certificate that evidences ADSs. Â ADSs are listed on the NYSE under the symbols RDS.A & RDS.B. Â Each ADS represents two ordinary shares, two A Shares in the case of Â RDS.A or two B Shares in the case of RDS.B. Â In many cases the terms ADR & ADS are used interchangeably.

Scrip Dividend Programme

RDS provides shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme.

Under the Programme shareholders can increase their shareholding in RDS by choosing to receive new shares instead of cash dividends if declared by RDS. Â Only new A Shares will be issued under the Programme, including to shareholders who currently hold B Shares.

Joining the Programme may offer a tax advantage in some countries compared with receiving cash dividends. In particular, dividends paid out as shares will not be subject to Dutch dividend withholding tax (currently 15 per cent) & will not generally be taxed on receipt by a UK shareholder or a Dutch corporate shareholder.

Shareholders who elect to join the Programme will increase the number of shares held in RDS without having to buy existing shares in the market, thereby avoiding associated dealing costs.

Shareholders who do not join the Programme will continue to receive in cash any dividends declared by RDS.

Shareholders who held only B Shares & joined the Scrip Dividend Programme are reminded they will need to make a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of their new A Shares if they wish to join the Programme in respect of such new shares. However, this is only necessary if the shareholder has not previously made a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of any new A Shares issued.

For further information on the Programme, including how to join if you are eligible, please refer to the appropriate publication available on www.shell.com/scrip.

Dividend timetable for the first quarter 2012 interim dividend


1st quarter 2012

Announcement dateApril 26, 2012
Ex-dividend dateMay 9, 2012
Record date May 11, 2012
Scrip reference share price announcement dateMay 16, 2012
Closing of scrip election & currency election (*)May 25, 2012
Pounds sterling & euro equivalents announcement dateJune 1, 2012
Payment dateJune 21, 2012

* A different scrip election date may apply to registered & non registered ADS holders.
Registered ADS holders can contact The Bank of New York Mellon for the election deadline that applies. Non registered ADS holders can contact their broker, financial intermediary, bank or financial institution for the election deadline that applies.
Both a different scrip & currency election date may apply to shareholders holding shares in a securities account with a bank or financial institution ultimately holding through Euroclear Nederl&. Â Please contact your broker, financial intermediary, bank or financial institution where you hold your securities account for the election deadline that applies.

Taxation cash dividends

Cash dividends on A Shares will be subject to the deduction of Netherl&s dividend withholding tax at the rate of 15%, which may be reduced in certain circumstances. Provided certain conditions are met, shareholders in receipt of A Share cash dividends may also be entitled to a non-payable dividend tax credit in the United Kingdom.

Shareholders resident in the United Kingdom, receiving cash dividends on B Shares through the Dividend Access Mechanism, are entitled to a tax credit. This tax credit is not repayable. Non-residents may also be entitled to a tax credit, if double tax arrangements between the United Kingdom & their country of residence so provide, or if they are eligible for relief given to non-residents with certain special connections with the United Kingdom or to nationals of states in the European Economic Area.

The amount of tax credit is 10/90ths of the cash dividend, the tax credit referable to the first quarter 2012 interim dividend of US$0.43 is US$0.05 per ordinary share & the dividend & tax credit together amount to US$0.48. The pounds sterling & euro equivalents will be announced on June 1, 2012.

Royal Dutch Shell plc
The Hague, April 26th, 2012

data.summary: Shell today published its Sustainability Report for 2011, which details how sustainable development helps it to deliver energy to meet the world's growing energy demand in a responsible way.
data.title: 2011 Shell sustainability report
data.maintext:
The report covers Shell's environmental & social performance for the year & outlines its contribution towards building a sustainable energy future. Shell's responsible approach includes investing steadily in natural gas resources & continued investment in technology & innovation to help it to deliver this energy.

Shell is producing more cleaner-burning natural gas, producing low-CO2 biofuel, helping to develop carbon capture & storage technologies, & working to improve its own energy efficiency. Shell is also offering its customers more advanced fuels & lubricants that help save energy.

"At Shell we believe that responsibly delivering cleaner, more reliable & affordable energy is the best contribution we can make today to a more stable world where economies can thrive," says Shell Chief Executive Officer Peter Voser in his introduction to the report.

The 2011 Shell Sustainability Report also focuses on the rigorous safety standards & practices we have developed over many years that allow us to operate responsibly in a range of challenging environments.

  • To read the full report go to www.shell.com/sustainabilityreport

data.summary: China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) & Shell China Exploration & Production Company Limited (Shell) today signed a Production Sharing Contract (PSC) for shale gas exploration, development & production in the Fushun-Yongchuan block in the Sichuan Basin, China.
data.title: CNPC & Shell sign first shale gas production sharing contract in China
data.maintext:
Subject to government approval, this is the first shale gas PSC ever signed in China. The contract area covers approximately 3,500 square kilometres.

Zhao Zhengzhang, Vice President of PetroChina Company Limited, & Lim Haw-Kuang, Executive Chairman of Shell Companies in China, signed the PSC at a ceremony in Beijing. Jiang Jiemin, Chairman of CNPC, & Peter Voser, Chief Executive Officer of Royal Dutch Shell plc, witnessed the signing.

"We are delighted about this new milestone in our strategic cooperation with CNPC," said Peter Voser. "China has huge shale gas potential & we are committed to making a contribution in bringing that potential into reality."

Shell will apply its advanced technology, operational expertise & global experience in the project to jointly develop the shale gas resources with CNPC.

Note for editors

Royal Dutch Shell plc is incorporated in England & Wales, has its headquarters in The Hague & is listed on the London, Amsterdam, & New York stock exchanges. Shell companies have operations in more than 90 countries & territories with businesses including oil & gas exploration & production; production & marketing of liquefied natural gas & gas to liquids; manufacturing, marketing & shipping of oil products & chemicals & renewable energy projects. For further information, visit www.shell.com.

Shell procured about $1b worth of equipment & services from China in 2011, of which $300m for its China upstream operations & $700m for its global businesses outside of China.

data.summary: Royal Dutch Shell plc (the "Company") announces its intention to propose to the 2012 Annual General Meeting that Sir Nigel Sheinwald GCMG be elected a Non-executive Director of the Company with effect from July 1, 2012.
data.title: Directorate change
data.maintext:
Sir Nigel Sheinwald is a senior British diplomat who served as British Ambassador to the United States from 2007 to 2012. He joined the Diplomatic Service in 1976 & served in Brussels (twice), Washington & Moscow & in a wide range of policy jobs in London. Prior to his appointment as British Ambassador to the United States, he served as Foreign Policy & Defence Adviser to the Prime Minister & Head of the Cabinet Office Defence & Overseas Secretariat. He served as British Ambassador & Permanent Representative to the European Union in Brussels from 2000 to 2003.

Sir Nigel was born in 1953 & educated at Balliol College, Oxford. He will retire from the Diplomatic Service at the end of March, 2012.

The proposed appointment has been approved by the British Government's Advisory Committee on Business Appointments.

data.summary: Royal Dutch Shell plc (the "Company") announces that Mr Hans Wijers, a Non-executive Director of the Company, Chairman of the Remuneration Committee & a member of the Nomination & Succession Committee, has been appointed Deputy Chairman & Senior Independent Director with effect from May 23, 2012. Mr Wijers will succeed Lord Kerr of Kinlochard who, as announced on February 1, 2012, will be standing down as a Non-executive Director of the Company with effect from the close of business of the 2012 Annual General Meeting.
data.title: Appointment of deputy chairman & senior independent director & board committee changes
data.maintext:
Mr Josef Ackermann, a Non-executive Director since 2008 & a member of the Remuneration Committee, has been appointed a member of the Nomination & Succession Committee with effect from May 23, 2012. Sir Nigel Sheinwald, who will be standing for election as a Non-executive Director of the Company at the 2012 Annual General Meeting, has been appointed a member of the Corporate & Social Responsibility Committee with effect from July 1, 2012.

data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced the pounds sterling & euro equivalent dividend payments in respect of the fourth quarter 2011 interim dividend, which was announced on February 2, 2012 at US$0.42 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share").
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc fourth quarter 2011 euro & GBP equivalent dividend payments
data.maintext:
Dividends on A Shares will be paid, by default, in euro at the rate of Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3202 per A Share. Holders of A Shares who have validly submitted pounds sterling currency elections by March 2, 2012 will be entitled to a dividend of 26.74p per A Share.

Dividends on B Shares will be paid, by default, in pounds sterling at the rate of 26.74p per B Share. Holders of B Shares who have validly submitted euro currency elections by March 2, 2012 will be entitled to a dividend of Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3202 per B Share.

This dividend will be payable on March 22, 2012 to those members whose names were on the Register of Members on February 17, 2012.

Taxation cash dividends

Dividends on A Shares will be subject to the deduction of Netherl&s dividend withholding tax at the rate of 15%, which may be reduced in certain circumstances. Provided certain conditions are met, shareholders in receipt of A Share dividends may also be entitled to a non-payable dividend tax credit in the United Kingdom.

Shareholders resident in the United Kingdom, receiving dividends on B Shares through the Dividend Access Mechanism, are entitled to a tax credit. This tax credit is not repayable. Non-residents may also be entitled to a tax credit, if double tax arrangements between the United Kingdom & their country of residence so provide, or if they are eligible for relief given to non-residents with certain special connections with the United Kingdom or to nationals of states in the European Economic Area.

The amount of tax credit is 10/90ths of the cash dividend, the tax credit referable to the fourth quarter 2011 interim dividend of US$0.42 (26.74p or Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3202) is US$0.05 (2.97p or Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.0356) per ordinary share & the dividend & tax credit together amount to US$0.47 (29.71p or Ã¢â€šÂ¬0.3558).

data.summary: Shell, BP, Maersk & the Japanese shipping industry today announced a joint initiative aimed at supporting community & job creation projects in the coastal regions of Somalia. This initiative is designed to make a contribution to the rebuilding of a stable & prosperous Somalia &, in so doing, reduce the risk of piracy to seafarers transiting the Indian Ocean. Each company will contribute around US$500,000 over a period of two years.
data.title: Joint industry contribution to support community projects in Somalia
data.maintext:
Grahaeme Henderson, Head of Shell Shipping, said today, "Ending piracy lies in part in helping the people of Somalia, & providing education & alternative livelihoods. Shell is proud to have contributed to the broader counter-piracy effort. We very much hope that others in industry will join us."

";Piracy is a problem at sea, which must be addressed by the international community, & requires a long-term sustainable solution on l&. We are willing to contribute to the solution, which is why Maersk supports this initiative,"; said Hanne B. Sorensen, CEO of Maersk Tankers, on behalf of the A.P. Moller - Maersk Group.

John Ridgway, Chief Executive of BP Shipping said: "This is a major issue which affects the safety & security of people working in global trade. We are pleased to support this initiative which will provide material help & opportunities for communities in the region."

The announcement coincides with the London Conference on Somalia being held today (23rd February) & hosted by the Prime Minister, the Rt. Hon David Cameron MP. Leaders from more than 50 countries & international organisations are focussing on seven key issues, including terrorism, piracy, humanitarian assistance &, crucially, what Somalis could do after the transitional government's m&ate expires in August.

Enquiries

BP Group Press Office: +44 207 496 4076
Maersk Group, Group Communications: +45 3363 1911

Royal Dutch Shell plc
Royal Dutch Shell plc is incorporated in England & Wales, has its headquarters in The Hague & is listed on the London, Amsterdam, & New York stock exchanges. Shell companies have operations in more than 100 countries & territories with businesses including oil & gas exploration & production; production & marketing of liquefied natural gas & gas to liquids; manufacturing, marketing & shipping of oil products & chemicals & renewable energy projects. data.summary: Shell announces today that Malcolm Brinded has agreed to step down as an Executive Director of the Company with effect from 1 April 2012. Mr Brinded has agreed to remain at Shell until 30 April 2012 in order to assist with the transition of his responsibilities.
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc board announces new upstream international director
data.maintext:
Mr Brinded is currently Executive Director Upstream International. He first joined Shell in October 1974 & has served the company in Brunei, the Netherl&s, Oman & the United Kingdom. In 1998 he became Managing Director of Shell UK Exploration & Production & from 1999 until 2002 he was Shell Country Chairman in the UK. He has been a member of the Royal Dutch Shell plc Board (& its predecessors) since 2002. Prior to his current role, he was Executive Director in charge of Exploration & Production.

Royal Dutch Shell Chief Executive Peter Voser commented "Malcolm Brinded has had a most distinguished career over many years & has made an important contribution to Shell's success during that time. He leaves the Upstream International business in a strong position, well-placed to deliver on its targets & pursue the next stage of Shell's growth."

At the same time the Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc announced the appointment of Mr &rew Brown as Upstream International Director. He will be a member of the Executive Committee & will be based in the Netherl&s.

Mr Brown has worked for Shell for over 27 years in various upstream leadership roles. Currently he is Executive Vice-President Qatar. Mr Brown holds a degree in Engineering Science from Cambridge University.

data.summary: The Board of Royal Dutch Shell plc ("RDS") today announced the Reference Share Price in respect of the fourth quarter interim dividend of 2011, which was announced on February 2nd, 2012 at $0.42 per A ordinary share ("A Share") & B ordinary share ("B Share") & $0.84 per American Depository Share ("ADS").
data.title: Royal Dutch Shell plc fourth quarter 2011 scrip dividend programme reference share price
data.maintext:
Reference Share Price

The Reference Share price is used for calculating a Participating Shareholder's entitlement under the Scrip Dividend Programme, as defined below.

Q4 2011
Reference share price (US$)36.315

The Reference Share Price is the US dollar equivalent of the average of the closing price for the Company's A Shares listed on Euronext Amsterdam for the five dealing days commencing on (& including) the date on which the Shares are first quoted ex-dividend in respect of the relevant dividend.

The Reference Share Price is calculated by reference to the Euronext Amsterdam closing price in euro. The US dollar equivalent of the closing price on each of the dealing days referred to above is calculated using a market currency exchange rate prevailing at the time.

Reference ADS Price

ADS stands for an American Depositary Share. ADR stands for an American Depositary Receipt. An ADR is a certificate that evidences ADSs. ADSs are listed on the NYSE under the symbols RDS.A & RDS.B. Each ADS represents two ordinary shares, two ordinary A Shares in the case of RDS.A or two ordinary B Shares in the case of RDS.B. In many cases the terms ADR & ADS are used interchangeably.

The A Reference ADS Price will apply to holders of A ADSs who are subject to Dutch withholding tax. The Alternative Reference ADS Price will apply to holders of A ADSs who are not subject to Dutch withholding tax & all holders of B ADSs.

Q4 2011
A reference ADS price (US$)73.911
Alternative reference ADS price (US$)73.719

The Reference ADS Price equals (i) the Reference Share Price of the two A Shares underlying each new A ADS plus (ii) the UK stamp duty reserve tax ("SDRT"), which is chargeable at 1.5 per cent. with respect to each new A ADS. The A Reference ADS Price will also include an amount equal to the Dutch withholding tax rate of 15 per cent. on the SDRT. The Alternative Reference ADS Price will not be adjusted to reflect Dutch withholding tax.

Scrip dividend programme

RDS provides shareholders with a choice to receive dividends in cash or in shares via a Scrip Dividend Programme.

Under the Programme shareholders can increase their shareholding in RDS by choosing to receive new shares instead of cash dividends if declared by RDS. Only new A Shares will be issued under the Programme, including to shareholders who currently hold B Shares.

Joining the Programme may offer a tax advantage in some countries compared with receiving cash dividends. In particular, dividends paid out as shares will not be subject to Dutch dividend withholding tax (currently 15 per cent) & will not generally be taxed on receipt by a UK shareholder or a Dutch corporate shareholder.

Shareholders who elect to join the Programme will increase the number of shares held in RDS without having to buy existing shares in the market, thereby avoiding associated dealing costs.

Shareholders who do not join the Programme will continue to receive in cash any dividends declared by RDS.

Shareholders who held only B shares & joined the Scrip Dividend Programme are reminded they will need to make a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of their new A shares if they wish to join the Programme in respect of such new shares. However, this is only necessary if the shareholder has not previously made a Scrip Dividend Election in respect of any new A shares issued.

For further information on the Programme, including how to join if you are eligible, please refer to the appropriate publication available on www.shell.com/scrip.

Royal Dutch Shell plc
The Hague, February 22, 2012

data.summary: Shell today announces a successful appraisal operation at its Appomattox discovery in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico.
data.title: Appraisal success at appomattox discovery
data.maintext:
The appraisal well in Mississippi Canyon block 348, in approximately 7,257 feet of water, was drilled to a total depth of 25,851 feet & encountered approximately 150 feet of oil pay.

Today's announcement builds on Shell's initial success at the Appomattox discovery well in Mississippi Canyon Block 392, completed in early 2010. "We are pleased with the continued success at our Appomattox prospect, & this well supports our continuing appraisal efforts to progress this to a new hub class development," said David Lawrence, Executive Vice President Exploration & Commercial.

Shell (80% WI & operator) & Nexen (20% WI) will continue to appraise Appomattox in 2012 with an appraisal well in the southwest fault block & a sidetrack appraisal into the northwest fault block to further delineate the hydrocarbon accumulation. Further Appomattox & Vicksburg appraisals, if warranted, may extend into early 2013.
